title: FINANCIAL ANALYST
text:
Job Ref: 21350 
Our client is a leading international law firm, providing clients with commercially aware legal advice, whenever and wherever they need it. They are based in 24 locations situated in key business and financial centres across Europe, the Middle East, and Asia. 
The firms’ business services groups provide integrated support for our global operations and they are looking for a Financial Analyst to join the Group Finance team and reporting to the Financial Analysis Manager. 
The role is responsible for the provision of financial analysis and support to the International Practice group Heads (IPGHs) in respect of their International Practice Groups. The role involves month end analysis and review, budget process support as well as ad-hoc queries and general financial analysis. 
Key Duties: 
* To produce analysis to help maximise profitability across the London groups, particularly analysing realisation, fee earner utilisation and working capital (lock-up) cycles as well as practice costs review and analysis * Responsible for monitoring performance against long-term strategic and short-term operational plans * Contribute towards the preparation of global financial management accounts and commentaries * Assist partners define and develop the necessary strategic plans and operational budgets for the business groups. * Actively involved in the production of such plans, including financial projections and budgets * Assist IPGHs in the preparation of business cases to be used to support the election of new partners or the hire of lateral partners within each business group. * Prepare business cases, financial models and accompanying documentation for other adhoc projects impacting the business group * The role is responsible for co-ordinating the provision of the necessary information, analysis, explanation and support to the partners to allow them to manage their business groups; including profitability and other KPIs, fee earner utilisation, billings and collections, compliance with time-recording policies 
Person specification: 
* Qualified with a recognised professional accounting qualification. ACCA, CIMA or ACA * Previous management accounting experience of budgeting, planning and financial modelling required. * Previous relevant experience within professional services essential, previous experience within a legal environment would be an advantage. 
Knowledge and technical skills: 
* Advanced Microsoft Excel skills * Competent Financial modelling and planning * Competent use of General Ledger and reporting systems (use of Dynamics AX ,Elite, Business Objects is an advantage * Strong technical accounting knowledge – maintains awareness of changes to GAAP and understands the consequences of such changes. * Strong communication skills – confident and ability to present well
